admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
subsc: Agro-industry, marketing, and trade,Animal production,Central government administration,General finance sector,Agricultural extension and research
trustfund:
TF033133-MACEDONIA - PRIVATE FARMER
            SUPPORT PROJECT,TF032875-MACEDONIA - AGRICULTURE AND
            PRIVATE SECTOR DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Private Farmer
            Support Project for Macedonia was satisfactory, the
            sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was substantial, and the Bank and Borrower
            performance were both satisfactory. The project provides a
            series of lessons concerning ownership, particularly in a
            society with low social capital. It is clear that ownership
            will be constantly challenged in a project overseen by seven
            different ministers, four Bank task managers, and two
            project managers operating in a weak agricultural policy
            environment and affected by the political instability of
            Macedonia. The lessons include: unforeseeable political
            events can powerfully affect project outcomes, the project
            management team needed to be able, flexible and independent
            of day-to-day politics, and project adjustments should occur
            in response to real government commitments, and project
            management capability. A project monitoring and evaluation
            program should be fully described and priced in the design
            document, project objectives must be as clear and measurable
            as possible, outputs must be designed to contribute to the
            achievement of each objective, and stakeholders should
            participate in monitoring and evaluation activities.
